basics.name: Saarang Panchavati
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: PhD candidate at UCLA working on neuroscience and AI.

work.name: Meta FAIR
highlights: Worked on developing foundation models for EEG (more info soon!).

work.name: University of California, Los Angeles
highlights: Developing a foundation model for EEG using deep state-space models and graph neural networks with over 10,000 hours of EEG data.
Using a novel clinical dataset to better understand neural connectivity in pediatric epilepsy.
Developing deep learning methods to explore neural correlates of gait in Parkinson’s Disease.
Building a BCI pipeline for deep learning-based motor imagery applications using PyTorch, BCI2000, and MNE.

work.name: Dascena
highlights: Evaluated deep learning models to predict C. Diff infection in the ICU, resulting in a journal publication.
Built predictive models using longitudinal EMR data for multiple clinical indications.
Developed EHR data processing pipelines using AWS and PySQL to enable analysis at scale.

work.name: Vertex Pharmaceuticals
highlights: Developed a data acquisition and analysis pipeline for continuous drug production data.
Built algorithms and a GUI for ETL and trend analysis on thousands of production reports.
Increased analysis speed by 500x using Tabula, Pandas, PyQt, SQL, and SEEQ.

work.name: UC Berkeley, Maharbiz Group
highlights: Designed novel automations and experiments to evaluate neural implant biocompatibility in silico.
Assembled automated accelerated aging experiments using Raspberry Pi, PySerial, and MATLAB, resulting in a conference publication.

work.name: Neurotech@Berkeley
highlights: Developed a seamless EEG analysis and modeling platform for commercially available EEG devices.
Created a data science-based curriculum to make neurotechnology accessible to the public.
Built collaborations with neurotechnology research groups, leading to a student-led neurotech course at UC Berkeley.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).
